intro: Diosma scabra, commonly known as the rough diosma, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Solanaceae, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its hairy, woody stems and alternate leaves. Diosma scabra is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
